intro: Taraxacum fridenii, commonly known as the Mexican dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces a yellow flower head that develops into a fluffy seed ball. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Taraxacum fridenii is known for its ability to tolerate various environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
